content:
• Tuesday, December 19, 2017
  • COINB

    Bitcoin Cash soars as Coinbase adds

    • Bitcoin Cash has been on a big run for the past few days on rumor it was soon to be available for trade on popular exchange Coinbase (COINB). Sure enough, it's happened, with BCH joining Bitcoin, Ether, and Litecoin on the Coinbase platform.
    • BCH has jumped nearly another 20% over the past hour, and at $3,191 is roughly double its price from Friday. Bitcoin, Ether, and Litecoin, on the other hand, are all selling off this evening. And the Coinbase site? It's crashed again.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 PM | 106 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: MU +5.1%. TA +2.5%. IONS +2.1%. ITCB +1.5%. FDX +1.4%.
    • Top losers: CCIH -11.5%. SFIX -10.3%. SCS -9.4%. INTX -8.7%. APEN -7.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 9 Comments
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix -11% in first earnings report as public company

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) -11.1% after-hours following its first earnings report as a publicly traded company, with FQ1 (Oct.) earnings and revenues edging analyst expectations.
    • However, SFIX says gross margins fell nearly three percentage points, hurt by investments into new categories, and the company says it continues to expect profit margins to decline in the near term as those investments ramp up.
    • SFIX says its active client count in the quarter jumped nearly 30% to 2.4M users as of Oct. 28.
    • Net revenue per active client for the 12 months ended Oct. 28 was $433, 1.4% lower than in the year ended Oct. 29, 2016.
    • SFIX issues upside revenue guidance for Q2, forecasting $287M-$294M vs. $286M analyst consensus, but sees EBITDA of $11.5M-$15.5M vs. $16M consensus.
    • For FY 2018, the company sees revenues of $1.17B-$1.22B vs. $1.18B consensus and EBITDA of $40M-$60M vs. $57.5M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Galectin secures $10M credit line; shares ahead 30% after hours

    • Nano cap Galectin Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GALT) is up 30% after hours on increased volume on the heels of its announcement that it has inked a $10M unsecured credit facility with new director Richard Uihlein.
    • Under the terms of the facility, the company can borrow at its discretion through year-end 2018.
    • In consideration of the credit line, Mr. Uihlein received warrants to purchase up to 1M common shares at $5.00 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 28 Comments
  • RHT

    Red Hat -3.9% despite Q3 beats, upside guidance

    • Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) shares are down 3.9% aftermarket despite Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $758M to $763M (consensus: $748.91M) and EPS at $0.81 (consensus: $0.75).
    • More Q4 guidance: GAAP operating margin, 16.7%; non-GAAP operating margin, 24.6%.
    • Upside FY18 guidance: revenue, $2.906B to $2.911B (consensus: $2.88B); GAAP operating margin, 16.1%; non-GAAP operating margin, 23.9%; EPS, $2.88 (consensus: $2.78).
    • Subscription revenue breakout: Infrastructure-related offerings, $495M (+14% Y/Y in constant currency); Application Development-related and other emerging tech, $162M (+42%). 
    • Key metrics: GAAP operating margin, 15.8% (guidance: 15.2%); deferred revenue, $2.11B (+19% Y/Y); operating cash flow, $160M (+18%); cash and equivalents, $2.32B.  
    • Press release
    • Listen to Red Hat's earnings call at 5 p.m. ET here.
    • Previously: Red Hat beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 25 Comments
  • MU

    Micron +3.1% after Q1 beats, upside EPS and NAND guidance

    • Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) shares are up 3.1% aftermarket following Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q2 guidance has revenue from $6.8B to $7.2B (consensus: $6.21B) and EPS from $2.51 to $2.65 (consensus: $2.03).
    • DRAM guidance: CY18 industry supply bit growth expected at about 20% and Micron expects FY18 to come in slightly below that figure. 
    • NAND guidance: CY18 industry supply bit growth expected at about 50% and Micron expects to come in “somewhat above” the industry. 
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 55.1% (guidance: 50% to 54%); operating income, $3.09B (guidance: $2.65B to $2.85B); operating expenses, $650M (guidance $575M to $625M); cash and equivalents, $6.2B; current debt, $1.4B. 
    • Press release  / Presentation slides 
    • Micron’s earnings call starts at 4:30 p.m. ET here.   
    • Previously: Micron Technology beats by $0.25, beats on revenue (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 177 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx zooms higher after strong profit guidance

    • FedEX (NYSE:FDX) tracks higher in AH trading after a strong FQ2 report.
    • Adjusted operating margin improved 30 bps to 8.5% during the quarter.
    • Investors have their eyes focused on the strong profit guidance from the shipper. FedEx guided for FY18 EPS of $12.70 to $13.30 vs. $12.00 to $12.80 prior and $12.48 consensus,
    • Shares of FedEX are up 2.50% AH.
    • Previously: FedEx beats by $0.29, beats on revenue (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx beats by $0.29, beats on revenue

    • FedEx (NYSE:FDX): Q2 EPS of $3.18 beats by $0.29.
    • Revenue of $16.3B (+9.2% Y/Y) beats by $620M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical +23% as CEO Hanson buys 36K-plus shares

    • Ion Geophysical (IO +23.4%) surges to a 52-week high after President and CEO Brian Hanson discloses the purchase of 36,351 shares at an average price of $13.05 each, for a total purchase of nearly $475K.
    • Hanson now owns nearly 155K shares of the company's common stock.
    • At least six other insiders, including IO's CFO and Senior VP also bought shares late last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • LOGM

    LogMeIn provides financial outlook for FY18, FY20

    • LogMeIn (NASDAQ:LOGM) provides FY18 and FY20 financial outlooks at its Investor Day.
    • FY18 organic outlook: revenue, $1.135B to $1.15B (may not compare to the $1.17B consensus); EBITDA, $440M; FCF, $375M.
    • FY20 target: revenue, $1.25B to $1.325B; EBITDA, $525M; FCF, $450M. 
    • LogMeIn shares are down 2.7%.        
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy -7% after quarterly shipments slump 48%

    • Yingli Green Energy (YGE -7%) thuds to a 52-week low after reporting a wider than expected Q3 loss to RMB2.3B ($355M) from a RMB335M loss a year earlier.
    • YGE says its Q3 PV module shipments fell 48% Q/Q to 597.7 MW vs. guidance for 550-600 MW, compared to 1,146 MW in Q2.
    • Chairman/CEO Liansheng Miao attributes the fall in quarterly shipments to lower demand from the end of H1, saying YGE tried to strike a balance between maintaining shipment volumes and ensuring that its operating cash flows remained sufficient.
    • YGE expects Q4 PV module shipments of 700-800 MW, and raises its full year PV module shipments guidance to 2.8-2.9 GW from its previous 2.5-2.8 GW.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • EXEL

    FDA OKs Exelixis' Cabometyx for first-line kidney cancer; shares ahead 3%

    • Under Priority Review status, the FDA approves the use of Exelixis' (EXEL +2.6%) CABOMETYX (cabozantinib) for the treatment of patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma (RCC) in a first-line setting. The agency's action date was February 25, 2018.
    • The data supporting the application was generated in the Phase 2 CABOSUN study which showed treatment with cabozantinib statistically significantly extended progression-free survival compared to standard-of-care treatment with Pfizer's SUTENT (sunitinib malate).
    • CABOMETYX was first approved in the U.S. in April 2016 for RCC in a second-line setting.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 27 Comments
  • AKAM

    Craig-Hallum upgrades Akamai on activist investor

    • Craig-Hallum upgrades Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM) from Neutral to Buy with an $80 price target.
    • The firm says that the arrival of activist investor Elliott Associates reshapes Akamai’s risk-reward balance.   
    • Akamai shares are up 2.5%.    
    • Previously: Akamai +10.7% after active stake reveal (Dec. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott, CBI plunge in reaction to merger nobody seems to like

    • McDermott (MDR -9.9%) and CB&I (CBI -7.9%) are both sharply lower as investors of both companies register their displeasure with MDR's $6B acquisition of CBI.
    • The market appears to have been taken by surprise, with MKM analyst Daniel Scott saying "the combination wasn't what we expected."
    • At 2.47221 per MDR share, the company is acquiring CBI at essentially no premium but MDR shareholders are wary of the deal because CBI's litany of problems with construction deadlines and cost overruns.
    • Motley Fool's Rich Smith calculates the two companies together carrying a combined net debt load approaching $1.8B, and instead of generating cash to pay off the debt, burning through a combined $522M in negative free cash flow over the past year.
    • The companies say they are targeting $250M of cost savings, with some coming from a 16% reduction in the combined companies' rather vague "other business related costs" in addition to the standard G&A expense streamlining, supply-chain savings and operations optimization.
    • As for CBI, the deal likely is as good as could be expected, but its execution challenges reduce the likelihood of a competitive bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 32 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: CCIH +140%. MEET +29%. TEUM +19%. BOSC +15%. KONE +13%.

  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs lower as yields break out to the upside

    • The 10-year Treasury yield had been holding in a fairly tight range of about 2.30-2.37% for the past couple of months, but has shot up to 2.47% today - it's highest level since early March.
    • Helping today's move higher in yields was a strong housing starts report for November.
    • The mortgage REITs (REM -4.3%) - many trading at negligible discounts to book value, if not premiums - are lower across the board, led by Annaly Capital (NLY -1.6%) and AGNC Investment (AGNC -1.8%).
    • Among other names: Armour (ARR -1.9%), CYS (CYS -2%), Western Asset (WMC -1.2%), Capstead (CMO -1.5%), MFA Financial (MFA -1.5%), Dynex (DX -1.4%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 18 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: IO +15%. MCF +14%. SDPI +9%. BXE +8%. EPE +6%.
    • Losers: YTEN -27%. MDR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • NWBO

    Northwest Bio launches convertible stock offering; shares down 5%

    • Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO -4.5%) commences an offering of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock under the SEC's Regulation D which allows exemptions from registration requirements.
    • Each Series B share, priced at $2.30, will be convertible into 10 common shares at $0.23. Buyers will also receive two-year warrants to purchase up to 10 common shares per Series B share acquired, exercisable at $0.30 per common share.
    • Closing date of the general solicitation is December 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 37 Comments
  • AAN

    New tax rule could benefit Aaron's and Rent-A-Center

    • Aaron's (AAN +6%) rallies after the retailer is singled out by Stifel Nicolaus as a company that is positioned to benefit from the proposed tax reform package.
    • Analyst John Baugh points to the deduction of capital expenditures. "Everyone is focusing on the change in the corporate tax rate, which looks like it will get reduced from 35% to 21%, but our lease-to-own companies, like Aaron’s and Rent-A-Center, receive another benefit from the ability to fully expense capital purchases,"  he writes,
    • "The ability to immediately deduct inventory purchases would dramatically reduce cash taxes paid in the near term," he adds.
    • Rent-A-Center (RCII +0.1%) isn't catching the same kind of buying action as Aaron's today.
    • Sources: CNBC and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 4 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: RCG +39%.
    • Losers: CCCR-OLD -13%. GROW -9%. LMFA -8%. BLX -6%. PBIB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • PCTY

    Dougherty & Co. initiates Paylocity

    • Dougherty & Co. initiates Paylocity (NASDAQ:PCTY) with a Neutral rating.  
    • Firm calls Paylocity a SaaS leader that can increase average revenue per client with continued platform and sales expansions.
    • Dougherty expects 22% top-line growth and 13% higher operating margins. 
    • But the firm thinks shares are accurately valued at the current 5.9x EV/S on the CY18 estimate.   
    • Paylocity shares are down 2.9%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • GKOS

    Glaukos on go to start pivotal study of next-generation iStent; shares up 1%

    • The FDA has signed off on the IDE from Glaukos (GKOS +1.2%) clearing the way for the launch of a pivotal study of its iStent SA Trabecular Micro-Bypass System to reduce intraocular pressure (IOP) in pseudophakic (no natural crystalline lens), mild-to-moderate primary open-angle, pigmentary or pseudoexfoliative glaucoma patients.
    • The iStent SA System consists of two micro-scale titanium stents that are injected into multiple trabecular network locations through a single entry point through the cornea. Once placed, IOP is mitigated by improved fluid drainage from the eye. It has the same fluidic method of action as the original iStent, approved in the U.S. in June 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: LENS +128%. PFNX +64%. MEET +31%. KONE +26%. CERC +20%. OTIV +19%. RCG +18%. RIOT +16%. CREG +14%. MCF +14%.
    • Losers: YTEN -26%. NVAX -22%. CCCR-OLD -14%. ICCC -14%. XNET -12%. BASI -11%. TRXC -10%. IPWR -10%. EYES -9%. LPTH -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • AMRX

    Impax jettisons Taiwan manufacturing facility; shares up 1%

    • Impax Laboratories (IPXL +1.3%) inks an agreement to sell its Taiwan-based manufacturing facility to Bora Pharmaceuticals for $18.5M.
    • Impax will record a pre-tax impairment charge of $70M - 80M this quarter to account for the loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • CEMI

    Chembio teams up with AstraZeneca to develop new biomarker test; shares up 1%

    • Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI +0.7%) will collaborate with AstraZeneca on the development of a novel quantitative point-of-care diagnostic test for an undisclosed biomarker.
    • Under the terms of the 18-month agreement, Chembio will receive up to $2.9M from AstraZeneca to support the effort. The test will be performed on Chembio's DPP System.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVON

    Sevion to reverse split shares 1:20 after the close; shares down 11%

    • Sevion Therapeutics (OTCQB:SVON -11.4%) will execute a 1:20 reverse split of its common shares effective at 4:00 pm ET today. Post-split trading will commence tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • OVID

    Ovid's lead candidate Fast Track'd for rare neuro-genetic disorder; shares ahead 5%

    • The FDA designates Ovid Therapeutics' (OVID +4.7%) lead candidate, OV101, for Fast Track review for the treatment of Angelman syndrome, a rare genetic disorder often misdiagnosed as cerebral palsy or autism.
    • Angelman patients were recently added to the company's Phase 2 STARS study. Topline data should be available in H2 2018.
    • Fast Track status provides for more frequent interaction with the FDA review team and a rolling review of the marketing application.
    • OV101 (gaboxadol) is a delta (δ)-selective GABAA receptor agonist designed to specifically target the disruption of tonic inhibition, a central physiological process of the brain that is believed to be the cause of certain neurodevelopmental disorders.
    • Previously: Ovid to include adolescents in mid-stage study of lead candidate OV101 in Angelman syndrome (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: OTIV +22%. FTFT +13%. KODK +10%. XNY +8%. NAV +7%.
    • Losers: ADOM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • INSY

    INSYS initiates mid-stage study of oral cannabidiol for "staring" seizures in kids; shares up 8%

    • INSYS Therapeutics (INSY +7.6%) initiates a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing cannabidiol (CBD) oral solution in epileptic children with treatment-resistant absence or "staring" seizures, a condition affecting as many as 8% of the 470K American children with epilepsy.
    • The open-label dose-finding study, INS011-17-103, should launch in late 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    MoffettNathanson outlines how Facebook shares could drop in 2018

    • MoffettNathanson reiterates its Buy rating and $205 price target for Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) but outlines how shares could fall in 2018.  
    • Analyst Michael Nathanson lists five weaknesses that could lead to the drop: uncertainty surrounding video strategy, hitting upper bound on ad load, questionable monetization potential for WhatsApp and Messenger, emerging regulatory risks, and a positive Street view that could change with “hiccups” in growth or profits.
    • Facebook shares are down 1.1%.  
    • Previously: U.S. says Facebook fought off cyber attacks; Germany questions data use (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 20 Comments
  • XIN

    Xinyuan Real Estate up 8.4% as SA contributor makes strong call

    • Xinyuan (XIN +8.4%) caught GeoTeam's attention after a bullish article on another China real estate play, Nam Tai Property (NYSE:NTP).
    • Geo figures the undercovered Xinyuan trades at nearly a 60% discount to book value. Meanwhile, shareholder-friendly management has been paying out a steadily increasing dividend, and buying back stock.
    • Maybe most exciting given the way markets are behaving of late, investors in Xinyuan are getting a free blockchain call option thanks to the company's partnership with IBM, and an agreement with a subsidiary of 58.com.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 5 Comments
  • EYEG

    EyeGate nabs new U.S. patent covering EGP-437; shares ahead 4%

    • The USPTO issues Patent No. 9,820,935 to EyeGate Pharmaceuticals (EYEG +4.1%) covering the method of delivering corticosteroids through iontophoresis to the eye, the mechanism of action of candidate EGP-437, licensed to Valeant Pharmaceuticals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • RIOT

    Andrew Left challenges Riot CEO to debate

    • Citron Research's Andrew Left yesterday announced a short position in Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT), calling the current situation "full mania."
    • Today, Left says Riot is making "false claims," and challenges CEO John O'Rourke to a live debate on CNBC's Fast Money this afternoon.
    • RIOT had been flying higher ahead of the latest Left tweet. It's since given back some of those gains, but is still up 15.5% on the session.
    • Previously: Crypto Co. trade halted by SEC (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 30 Comments
  • ARRY

    Array Bio teams up with Pfizer on combo cancer therapies; shares up 2%

    • Array BioPharma (ARRY +1.8%) and Pfizer (PFE -0.3%) will collaborate on clinical trials assessing the safety and efficacy of several immunotherapy combinations to treat cancer. Studies will evaluate the combination of Array's MEK inhibitor binimetinib and Pfizer's PARP inhibitor talazoparib and PD-L1 inhibitor avelumab (being co-developed with Merck KGaA).
    • A Phase 1b trial will evaluate doublet and triplet approaches across a range of tumor types with an initial focus on non-small cell lung cancer and pancreatic cancer. The study should commence by Q3 2018.
    • Pfizer will sponsor the study while Array will supply product.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 11 Comments
  • ONCE

    FDA OKs Spark's Luxturna for inherited retinal disease; shares up 1%

    • As expected, the FDA approves Spark Therapeutics' (ONCE +1.4%) gene therapy LUXTURNA (voretigene neparvovec) for the treatment of patients with biallelic RPE65-mutation-associated retinal dystrophy.
    • An advisory committee unanimously backed approval in October.
    • Previously: Ad Com backs Spark's Luxturna gene therapy for type of retinal dystrophy (Oct. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 8 Comments
  • ZBH

    New chief at Zimmer Biomet; shares up 6%

    • Zimmer Biomet Holdings (ZBH +6.3%) appoints Bryan Hanson as President & CEO effective today. Interim CEO Daniel Florin will continue to serve as SVP and CFO.
    • Previously, Mr. Hanson was EVP and President of the Minimally Invasive Therapies Group at Medtronic.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • FB

    U.S. says Facebook fought off cyber attacks; Germany questions data use

    • The U.S. homeland security adviser says Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) disabled North Korean cyber actions last week.
    • Tom Bossert didn’t provide additional details but urged other companies to participate in cyber security defense. 
    • In Germany, an antitrust watchdog says Facebook abused its position by monetizing the personal data of users. Facebook denies the charges. 
    • The comments come after the Federal Cartel Office finished a 20-month probe into the company. The authority questioned Facebook’s requirement to access third-party data when a user opens an account and how the social network tracks users across different websites.   
    • Facebook shares are down 1.3%.  
    • Previously: WhatsApp could face fine for data sharing (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 12 Comments

    • Gainers: LENS +136%. PFNX +55%. CERC +18%. RIOT +16%. CANF +15%.
    • Losers: NVAX -18%. ICCC -16%. EYES -8%. TRXC -7%. BLPH -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • AKER

    Akers' equity offering sinks shares, down 61%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Akers Biosciences (AKER -61.4%) slumps on a 23x surge in volume in response to its $6M public equity offering.
    • The offering consists of 15.5M Class A Units at $0.15, each comprised of one share of common stock and one five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $0.1875, and 3,675 Class B Units at $1,000.
    • Each Class B unit consists of one share of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock valued at $1,000 plus one five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $0.1875. Series B shares are convertible into an aggregate of 24.5M common shares (~6,667 common shares/Series B share) at an undisclosed price.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 6M shares of common stock and warrants to purchase up to 6M shares.
    • Closing date is December 21.
    • Yesterday's close was $0.395.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 8 Comments
  • AGCO

    AGCO -4% as 2018 earnings guidance misses consensus

    • AGCO (AGCO -4.1%) tumbles more than 4% as its forecast for 2018 adjusted EPS fails to meet analyst expectations.
    • At an analyst presentation today, AGCO issued guidance for FY 2018 EPS of ~$3.50 vs. $3.83 analyst consensus estimate, as projected 2018 farm income remains under pressure.
    • However, AGCO's 2018 revenue forecast of $9B exceeds analyst consensus of $8.48B; the company also sees 2017 capex totaling $50M.
    • AGCO peers Deere (DE -0.3%), Caterpillar (CAT -0.5%) and Lindsay (LNN -0.4%) are modestly lower.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 4 Comments

  • New leg higher in yields after fast housing starts print

    • Housing starts rose to a seasonally-adjusted annualized rate of 1.297M in November, up 3.3% from October and 12.9% from a year ago. It's also the second-strongest pace since the financial crisis.
    • Excluding more volatile multifamily numbers, single-family starts rose 5.3% M/M in November.
    • The news has helped send the 10-year Treasury yield up a full five basis points to 2.44%. The yield is now higher by about 40 basis points since Labor Day, and within sight of the 2017 high of 2.62% touched in early March.
    • TLT -1%, TBT +2%
    • ETFs: TLT, TBT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, TLH, UBT, SPTL, DLBS, VUSTX, TYBS, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • LENS

    Presbia up big on heels of business reboot; shares ahead 150%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Presbia (LENS +149.6%) is up on a healthy 30x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 207K shares. No particular news accounts for today's action.
    • Last week, the company announced a realignment of strategic priorities and a cash infusion that should be sufficient to fund operations through next year.
    • At the end of Q3, it had $7M in cash while operations consumed $10.7M during the first nine months of the year.
    • Previously: Presbia announces board and management changes and financing proposal (Dec. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival rides out hurricanes better than anticipated

    • Carnival (CCL +2.4%) trades higher after topping estimates comfortably with its FQ4 report.
    • The company's gross revenue yield growth of 6.8% per available lower berth day was outpaced by a 9.7% increase in gross cruise costs per ALBD.
    • The disruptions from hurricanes shaved about $0.11 off of EPS during the quarter.
    • "Despite booking disruptions from this year's multiple hurricanes, we are still heading into 2018 with a stronger base of business and higher prices than last year," says Carnival CEO Arnold Donald.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 3 Comments
  • CRCW

    Crypto Co. trade halted by SEC

    • Citing concern on the accuracy and adequacy of information in the marketplace, the SEC has suspended trading Crypto Co (OTC:CRCW). The suspension is to stay in place through January 3.
    • The thinly traded stock - backed by a company with very little in the way of assets or income - exploded to as high as a $12B valuation earlier this month.
    • Previously: Bitcoin mania as seen in a stock (Dec. 13)
    • Checking other blockchain-related absurdities, Longfin (OTCPK:LFIN) is down a mere 8.5% today to $66.15, and now off 50% from yesterday's peak. The recently-IPO'd fintech company sports just shy of a $4B valuation.
    • Previously: Longfin rocketship still going (Dec. 18)

  • CLVS

  • GBTC

    South Korean crypto exchange collapses; BTC slides under $18K

    • Seoul-based exchange Youbit suffered its second cyberattack in eight months on Tuesday morning, losing 17% of its total assets. Parent company Yapian suspended trading and filed for bankruptcy.
    • Exchange clients were told they were able to withdraw about 75% of their crypto holdings today, with the rest to be returned after bankruptcy proceedings.
    • Youbit allowed trading in 10 digital currencies, Bitcoin and Ether among them.
    • BTC this morning is down 5.2% to $17,980. Ether continues its big run, up 4% to $817.50.
